A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
It's a fantastic movie\, it really is.  Sure\, you're not going to get answers to Snoke and Rey's lineage is literally nothing\, but that's fine.  The disappointments people experienced are born of the hype.  I'm glad we didn't have another boring Sith master/apprentice dichotomy to suss out or for Rey's parents to be someone special.  It was a relief.  The movie sacrificed these pointless details for tempo\, to its benefit.

These details are nothing compared to the boring Skywalker story arc though.  The movie was completely amazing until they wrote Skywalker out of the series.  And that's not to say I have any issue with that at all.  It's just the way they did it.  It was cheap and lazy.  

It's a solid movie that sinks itself with a mediocre plot device at the end.
